result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gretchen L Smith

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM Defendant Gretchen L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. appeared by video for Gretchen L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR640 tracking with 22CF67:
Atty Singh needs some more time on the matter; requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically and gives a copy to Atty Singh.  Atty Singh states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading. Atty Singh enters a Not Guilty plea.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued

3:13 PM Defendant Gretchen L Smith in court.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. in court for Gretchen L Smith.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22TR640 tracking with 22CF67:
Atty Singh is prepared to proceed today.  State filed an amended criminal complaint.  Atty Singh states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading. 
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Deputy Bradley Wendt called and sworn; examined by Atty Burdon.  Defendant identified by Witness.  Exhibit 1 (driving record) marked by Atty Burdon.  Atty Burdon moves Exhibit 1.  Atty Singh has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 1 received

3:41pm  Cross-examined by Atty Singh
witness excused

Atty Burdon asks for a bind over and makes arguments.
Atty Singh objects to the bind over and makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gretchen L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. appeared by video for Gretchen L Smith. 
22TR640 tracking with 22CF67:
Atty Singh just received discovery but has not reviewed it with his client; requests a Prelim be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Receipt Number: 22R 002498,
Amount: $20.00

10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gretchen L Smith in court. Attorney Sarvan Singh appears on behalf of the defendant.
22TR640 tracking with 22CF67:
Atty Singh states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Singh asks for a Prelim to be set.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Singh waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gretchen L Smith

Prior: N466 W Setter Ln, Waupaca, WI 54981

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gretchen L Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Catherine Dorl appears by video means on behalf of the Defendant for bail purposes.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Dorl states that the defendant does not qualify for Public Defender but will appear today as a special appearance.
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Dorl asks for a signature bond and makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
